metadata.name: Sea Witch - Tentacle Spiral Scarf
metadata.author: Jay Edwards
metadata.description: A spiraling, tentacle-like scarf featuring prominent bobble stitches that create a sucker-like texture. The piece is shaped with dynamic increases and decreases to form its unique shape.
metadata.patternSource: v1.1 of pattern PDF with corrected repeat logic

primary.name: Gemstone
primary.substitutionNotes: Any bulky weight yarn. A lighter weight yarn can be used for a shorter, narrower scarf.

notions.description: A surface for pinning and shaping the scarf
T-pins or blocking pins for shaping

notions.item: stitch counter or locking stitch markers

gauge.notes: Should create a somewhat dense fabric.

sizing.notes: Finished size is post-blocking. A lighter weight yarn will result in a smaller scarf.

specialInstructions.blocking: Press the centres of your bobbles inward before and during blocking to produce a sucker shape. Block to desired measurements.

notes.general: This pattern is worked flat and builds in sections of increasing and then decreasing complexity.
notes.designNotes: Inspired by sea life, this scarf mimics the shape and texture of a tentacle.

k.name: Knit
k.description: Insert right needle through front of stitch, wrap yarn, pull through.

kfb.name: Knit Front and Back
kfb.description: Knit into the front then back of the same stitch.

k2tog.name: Knit 2 Together
k2tog.description: Insert the righthand needle into the first two stitches on the lefthand needle from left to right, then wrap the yarn and pull through as with a normal knit stitch.

BO1.name: Bind Off 1
BO1.description: Knit 2 stitches, then slip the first stitch over the second stitch.

MB3.name: Make Bobble 3
MB3.description:
Knit into the stitch, but do not pull it off the left needle.
Yarn over, then knit into the same stitch 1 time (3 sts total in bobble).
Drop the worked stitch from the left needle.
Turn work, purl 3.
Turn work, knit 3.
Turn work, purl 3.
Turn work, k2tog, k1, k2tog.
Pass the first stitch on the right-hand needle over the second. Repeat until 1 stitch remains.

MB5.name: Make Bobble 5
MB5.description:
Knit into the stitch, but do not pull it off the left needle.
Yarn over, then knit into the same stitch 2 times (5 sts total in bobble).
Drop the worked stitch from the left needle.
Turn work, purl 5.
Turn work, knit 5.
Turn work, purl 5.
Turn work, k2tog, k3, k2tog.
Pass the first stitch on the right-hand needle over the second. Repeat until 1 stitch remains.

MB7.name: Make Bobble 7
MB7.description:
Knit into the stitch, but do not pull it off the left needle.
Yarn over, then knit into the same stitch 3 times (7 sts total in bobble).
Drop the worked stitch from the left needle.
Turn work, purl 7.
Turn work, knit 7.
Turn work, purl 7.
Turn work, k2tog, k5, k2tog.
Pass the first stitch on the right-hand needle over the second. Repeat until 1 stitch remains.

MB9.name: Make Bobble 9
MB9.description:
Knit into the stitch, but do not pull it off the left needle.
Yarn over, then knit into the same stitch 4 times (9 sts total in bobble).
Drop the worked stitch from the left needle.
Turn work, purl 9.
Turn work, knit 9.
Turn work, purl 9.
Turn work, k2tog, k7, k2tog.
Pass the first stitch on the right-hand needle over the second. Repeat until 1 stitch remains.

steps.description: Begin the project by casting on 3 stitches.

steps.notes: End of Setup. You should have 9 sts.
End of 3 Stitch Bobbles. You should have 16 sts.
End of 5 Stitch Bobbles. You should have 29 sts.
End of 7 Stitch Bobbles. You should have 50 sts.

steps.description: Finish the project by binding off all remaining stitches.
